decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed Location Plan; 060923_004_01(8644). 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - (a) Any advertisement displayed and any site used for the display of advertisements shall be retained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the local planning authority. 
(b) Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition. 
(c) Where an advertisement is required under these Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) (England) Regulations 2007 to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the local planning authority. 
(d) No advertisement shall be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission. 
(e) No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, railway, waterway or aerodrome (civil or military).
Reason: To comply with Regulation 14(1) and Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) (England) Regulations 2007 and to comply with paragraph 136 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023.
Condition : 4 - The maximum steady brightness of the fascia sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 500 candelas per sq.m.
Reason: To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Local Plan policy LP9 and to comply with paragraph 136 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023.
Condition : 5 - The maximum steady brightness of the projecting sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 500 candelas per sq.m. 
Reason: To ensure the proposed sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Local Plan (2023) and to comply with paragraph 136 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023.
Condition : 6 - The illumination of the sign(s) hereby permitted shall be by static illumination only. 
Reason: In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with Locla Plan policy LP9 and to comply with paragraph 136 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023.
description: Display of externally illuminated fascia and projecting signs.
